name: Roomzzz Aparthotel Manchester City

reviews.text: Wanting a change from the norm of a hotel room, we opted for the Penthouse at Roomzzz for a very special weekend. It did take some convincing by my partner initially but it was Worth the endless begging & pleading to trust his judgement! You have the luxury of having being able to isolate yourself in a contemporary space combined with the heart of Manchester accessible from your doorstep. So trust your man, think outside the box (or live outside one in this case!) & spend a weekend at Roomzzz!
reviews.title: Perfect Penthouse

reviews.text: What a gem! The double rain shower, Imac, kitchenette, all brilliant coupled with style and great staff, I'd say rivals the overpriced lightbox ! We will be back near a Tesco for wine and a great meal in Chinatown , we used it to stay for a gig at Manchester academy xx
reviews.title: Brilliant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We treated ourselves to a two night stay in the penthouse here when we got married down the road at the art gallery. We could not initially agree on which hotel to stay in and so we ended up compromising and staying here as we both liked the look of it but hadn't imagined we'd stay in an apartment rather than a proper hotel for our wedding night. However, we were both so glad that we did as the place was amazing! It was very stylish and had all the facilities you would want. I would definitely use Roomzzz again.
reviews.title: Great place to stay

reviews.text: Great stay. Room very clean, stylish and spacious. Central location to shops and bars, multi storey parking around corner at approx £12 a day. Room pretty noisy on a night from local streets however would stay again.
reviews.title: Great stay

reviews.text: a regular visitor to Manchester always opting for hotels. Decided to give the aparthotel a go and must admit that I was very pleasantly surprised. I felt I was getting the best of both worlds. I tend to eat out and use rooms just for relaxing & sleeping, but feel that future visits that I can prepare breakfast, snacks etc. and not feel "cheeky" bringing my own food/drink into the hotel.
reviews.title: loved the cross over between hotel & apartment

reviews.text: Booked this hotel originally for one night, after being in the room 10 mins decided to book a extra night. Great value for money, compared to other big hotel chains (hilton etc.) Which were around £50 more per night, even with the good price the standard of rooms and service was better than the big chains. Its less than a 10 minute walk to the shops, bars and restaurants close there is nothing to complain about. Rooms were very big and stylish, had your own little kitchen and bathroom was very clean. Grab and go breakfast is such a good idea, large selection of fresh pastries, fruit juice .. could go on! Could fault this place at all, would recommend it to anyone & will be returning in the future.
reviews.title: Great value!

reviews.text: Before I start, I want to say I've used this hotel many times and generally I've been very pleased. For the price you pay the facilities are excellent, computers in rooms, free wi-fi, brilliant shower room and one of the most comfortable beds I've slept in! For some time I used it almost weekly and never thought I'd use another hotel in Manchester.
reviews.title: Great hotel - 2 stars feels harsh but had two terrible nights in a row!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: However, the last couple of times I've stayed I've been put in room 409 which has been incredibly noisy all night. Not through people at street level - pretty much a given since it's so central - but because of pipes making lots of noise throughout the night, walls seemingly very thin between rooms, the AC unit coming on at random times very loudly and general lift noise. Both times when it comes to check out, noone has asked how my stay was, usually they just take the key back and go back to their computer.
reviews.title: Good Location/interesting toilet,shower arrangement
good to have a little apartment instead of just room
reviews.text: Like I said, I'd rather not criticise as the hotel is very good value for money, but there's a few things which are holding it back. I'll refuse this room if I stay again!

It seems to be difficult to find a good hotel in Manchester. Roomzzz is a good choice located at China Town. It is about 10 minutes walk to the shopping street and main shopping mall area. It is very close to the tram station and 4/5 stations away from Old Trafford if you are going to watch a football match. Had a problem with the cleanliness of the toilet when we arrived but the reception sorted it out quickly but kind of left a mark on our perception of the hotel. The staff offered us free drink or food, late checkout etc. for this but again it is more psychological with cleanliness.
reviews.title: Outstanding
Love this place.....
reviews.text: Second time we have stayed here. The first time on first floor studio but this time grande studio on second floor. The room was fantastic, lots of space, clean, comfortable, the best shower, lots hot water, an iMac to surf the net, seriously what more can you ask for! We will never stay in a hotel again. The location is great, china town, main shops, canal street, metro link is all within a 10 minute walk. This has to be the best place to stay in town because also it's quiet! No traffic, no noise, fully equipped. If you could moan at anything perhaps the towel wasn't fluffy, so what!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed in room 508, which is a split level mezzanine style room.
reviews.title: Roomzzz a practical guide for travellers...

reviews.text: Looking at the manager's comments on another review, it would seem like this room has now been refurbished but I would still like to give my review, as that is what TA is about. However, I must add that it must have been the quickest refurbishment ever, as I only stayed there two weeks ago!
reviews.title: Amazing stay - a welcoming home away from home...

reviews.text: Firstly, this review is about the practicalities of this apartment from my point of view, as a woman. It is not about whether my points are good or bad but how they affect me as a traveller.
reviews.title: Brilliant stay, recommended to everyone!

reviews.text: Ok, so here we go.
reviews.title: Amazing. Will definitely be back!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked a "Liberty Suite" room type. The decor was smart, modern and clean with a great comfy bed and bathroom complete with "wet room" type shower. Didn't really use the mini-kitchen but it had sufficient appliances for any short term stay.
reviews.title: Superb accommodation and great location

reviews.text: Discounted parking is available on the same block for less than £14.00 a night.
reviews.title: Not as good as I remembered.

reviews.text: I should also mention the staff were charming and friendly on check-in and departure and the lobby offers a small pantry and tea/coffee facilities.
reviews.title: great
Superb!!
reviews.text: Phenomenal location. Close to Piccadilly and Deansgate. Within Chinatown, and on the cusp of Canal St. So always plenty going on. Lots of great restaurants nearby tomorrow, especially around the financial district.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Phenomenal service. All the reception staff were exceptionally cheery, courteous and helpful.
reviews.title: Sunday night away :-) x

aka: Roomzzz Aparthotel Manchester City Hotel Manchester
description: Roomzzz Manchester - As you'd expect from a luxury hotel in Manchester, there's every concession to contemporary style and comfort with 48 individual apartments to choose from - from compact studios to spacious suites. Each one fully fitted for the practicalities of daily life; each one finished with a subtle suggestion of the Orient inspired by the bustle of nearby Chinatown.
